definition: thoroughfare/to go straight ahead/to rush/to clash
step with the left foot (Kangxi radical 60)/see also 彳亍[chi4 chu4]
step with the right foot/see 彳亍[chi4 chu4]
conflict/to conflict/clash of opposing forces/collision (of interests)/contention
to attack/to batter/(of waves) to pound against/shock/impact
to have an urge/to be impetuous/impulse/urge
buffer/to cushion/to adjust to sharp changes
to collide/jerking motion/to impinge/to offend/to provoke

sentences.english: We also use instant tea and coffee.
sentences.chinese: 他們也喜歡喝馬上衝馬上喝的茶和咖啡。

sentences.english: He swilled his room out with antiseptic.
Earlier today, he even made her a cup of tea, which still appears to be a novelty for all involved.
sentences.chinese: 今早他甚至爲媽媽衝了一杯茶，這實在是前所未有。

sentences.english: He drove the police car at full throttle and dashed at the gangsters.
sentences.chinese: 他駕駛着警車開足馬力向匪徒衝去。

sentences.english: Don't swill the tealeaves out into the sink.

sentences.chinese: 丹尼斯衝男人大聲吼道。

sentences.english: In the locker room I pull off my clothes and take a one-minute shower.
sentences.chinese: 我在更衣室脫下了衣服，衝了一分鐘澡。

sentences.english: When the bell rang, the pupils ran helter-skelter out of the door.
sentences.chinese: 下課鈴響時，學生們蜂擁衝出門去。

sentences.english: The stage for life is not big enough for us to rush all the way.
sentences.chinese: 人生的舞臺並不大，容不得我們一直往前衝。

sentences.english: Take a knife, rushed to banks, there will be shuttle bus to pick you.
sentences.chinese: 拿把刀，衝到銀行，會有專車來接你的。

sentences.english: The front door of the office flew open. In burst a young man with a gun.
sentences.chinese: 店門突然推開，衝了進來的是個少年郎，手中握着槍。

sentences.english: Flood waters poured through a gap in the embankment of the swollen jumna river.
sentences.chinese: 亞穆納河漲水，洪水從河堤的一道決口衝了出來。

sentences.english: But why does the gate of this prime minister's residence face the north?
sentences.chinese: 可是這陳閣老宅的大門怎麼衝北面開啊？

sentences.english: The wild animal charged at us suddenly.
sentences.chinese: 野獸突然向我們衝了過來。

sentences.english: Sounds like someone needs a cold shower.
sentences.chinese: 聽起來有人需要衝一個冷水澡了。

sentences.english: Thick dust and smoke rush through downtown Manhattan.
sentences.chinese: 濃煙與灰塵衝過曼哈頓下城的街道。

definition: (of water) to dash against/to mix with water/to infuse/to rinse/to flush/to develop (a film)/to rise in the air/to clash/to collide with
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
to overtake/to catch up with/to hurry/to rush/to try to catch (the bus etc)/to drive (cattle etc) forward/to drive (sb) away/to avail oneself of (an opportunity)/until
to clasp under the arm/to coerce
despite/although/even though/in spite of/unhesitatingly/do not hesitate (to ask, complain etc)/(go ahead and do it) without hesitating
see 壓根兒|压根儿[ya4 gen1 r5]
to press/to push down/to keep under (control)/pressure
to attack/to accuse/to charge/an attack (terrorist or military)
to throw oneself at/to pounce on/to devote one's energies/to flap/to flutter/to dab/to pat/to bend over
